intro: Vincentella revoluta, commonly known as the revolute Vincentella, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
